subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: ... With annotations, you no longer need to extend TestCase. The reason:  methods that used to have to be named a certain way in order to be noticed by the
messageBody:
On 9/15/06, Marvin Toll <MarvinToll@...> wrote:
>
>
> Mark,
>
> Could you clarify? Perhaps a simple code sample of "deriving a test
> case from any class"? (I'm not tracking with this.)


With annotations, you no longer need to extend TestCase.

The reason: methods that used to have to be named a certain way in order to
be noticed by the testing framework (test*, setUp, tearDown) can now be
marked by annotations.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
